word.entryDescription: to finish all that's available of something
word.entryExample: We use up natural resources, like water, oil and wood.

word.entryDescription: capable of being used; in good enough condition to be used
word.entryExample: I've dropped the toaster but it is still usable.

word.entryDescription: expression that says that something happened regularly or all the time in the past, but does not happen now
word.entryExample: My granddad used to use the computer, but now he uses his tablet.

word.entryDescription: helping you do something
word.entryExample: The rainforest contains many fine plants, but none is more useful than the rubber tree.

word.entryDescription: in the way that most often happens
word.entryExample: My cat usually sleeps in our library.

word.entryDescription: an electrical piece of equipment that cleans floors
word.entryExample: We keep the vacuum cleaner in the cupboard under the stairs.

word.entryDescription: being too satisfied with your good looks, qualities or achievements
word.entryExample: I'm not vain, I just care about what I look like.

word.entryDescription: somebody who intentionally causes damage to other people's property and things in public places
word.entryExample: Police caught the vandal breaking the windows and spraying paint on the walls of the café.

word.entryDescription: the crime of intentionally damaging other people's or public property
word.entryExample: In inner cities today, vandalism of public property is an increasing problem.

word.entryDescription: consisting of or including various kinds or forms; diverse
word.entryExample: The menu was really varied, too, with some unusual combinations of toppings.

word.entryDescription: many different kinds
word.entryExample: Variety is the spice of life!

word.entryDescription: a liquid that becomes hard and shiny when it dries; used to protect wooden surfaces
word.entryExample: There was a sharp smell of varnish in the hotel we arrived at.

word.entryDescription: to change or be different
word.entryExample: If you vary your work you won't get bored.

word.entryDescription: plants, roots or seeds, that are used as food, especially in dishes that are not sweet
word.entryExample: I eat a lot of vegetables for lunch because they're healthy.

word.entryDescription: suitable for people not eating meat
word.entryExample: Is there a vegetarian main course?

word.entryDescription: somebody who does not eat meat
word.entryExample: Tom's mum is worried that he is a vegetarian.

word.entryDescription: not eating meat or fish
word.entryExample: Mum's fine now that I showed her how healthy vegetarianism can be.

word.entryDescription: something used to transport people or goods, particularly something with an engine used on the road
word.entryExample: It isn't yet clear how many vehicles were involved in the collision.

word.entryDescription: a material used to fasten clothes, bags, etc consisting of one part with a lot of very small hooks and another with a lot of very small loops, which stick together
word.entryExample: Velcro is a truly modern fastening.

word.entryDescription: an oval banked track used for bicycle racing
word.entryExample: The first velodromes were constructed in the 19th century.

word.entryDescription: a place where a performance, meeting or special event happens
word.entryExample: The paintings are being taken to the venue for the next exhibition tomorrow.

word.entryDescription: to a great degree
word.entryExample: A crocodile has got very big teeth and a very long tail.

word.entryDescription: used to make a verb stronger
word.entryExample: I don't like this room very much. Can I have a different room?

word.entryDescription: somebody who treats sick and injured animals
word.entryExample: My sister wants to be a vet.

word.entryDescription: full of life and energy
word.entryExample: New York is a vibrant city.

word.entryDescription: somebody who has suffered or died as a result of a crime, accident, illness, etc
word.entryExample: The victim is recovering in hospital.

word.entryDescription: the winning of a battle, game, competition, etc
word.entryExample: The match ended with victory to my brother, who defeated Alex 7-5 6-1.

word.entryDescription: a meeting among people at remote locations by means of transmitted audio and video signals
word.entryExample: The video conference starts at 1.00 p.m. so we need to have the equipment ready by then.

word.entryDescription: the area that can be seen from somewhere
word.entryExample: The view from the top of the mountain is fantastic.

word.entryDescription: a small area where people live in the countryside
word.entryExample: I like living in my village.

word.entryDescription: (in Britain) common open area within a village or other settlement; traditionally it was an area of grass in the centre of a village, used for public events
word.entryExample: There's a church in front of the village green.

word.entryDescription: a climbing plant with a wooden stem
word.entryExample: Green, black and white peppercorns all come from the same plant, which is a type of vine.

word.entryDescription: old or outmoded pieces of clothing worn on the upper half of the body
word.entryExample: Hipsters usually wear tight, skinny jeans and vintage tops.

word.entryDescription: intentionally causing physical harm to people
word.entryExample: In many countries, there is less murder and violent crime now than 20 years ago.

word.entryDescription: ability to see
word.entryExample: We learn that vision may positively affect our sense of balance.

word.entryDescription: somebody's idea of what things should be like
word.entryExample: There is a saying that people without vision perish.

word.entryDescription: to go somewhere, e.g. a museum, and spend time there, usually for pleasure
word.entryExample: Tommy wants to see a dinosaur skeleton. Why don't we visit Natural History Museum?

word.entryDescription: a natural chemical which is necessary for good health
word.entryExample: We need vitamin D to build strong bones.

word.entryDescription: very clearly
word.entryExample: I think the thing I remember most vividly about the rocket's lifting off was the countdown.

word.entryDescription: connected with the skills, knowledge, etc. that you need to do a particular job
word.entryExample: There has been an increase in the number of people undergoing vocational training in our country in recent years.

word.entryDescription: full of life and energy
word.entryExample: Vesuvius is a famous volcano.

word.entryDescription: the amount of space that an object or a substance fills
word.entryExample: You can measure volume of a liquid with a measuring jug.

word.entryDescription: of your own choice/will
word.entryExample: They do a lot of voluntary work for the Red Cross.

word.entryDescription: easy to harm or attack, or easy to influence in a bad way
word.entryExample: Small animals are often vulnerable to attack.

word.entryDescription: money that you earn
word.entryExample: This organisation makes people aware of the problem of low wages in developing countries.

word.entryDescription: to delay starting something or to stay somewhere until something else happens
word.entryExample: Did Mrs Wong wait for Kate and Harry for a long time?

word.entryDescription: a man who takes customers' orders and serves food and drinks at tables in a restaurant
word.entryExample: I've got a job as a waiter in a pizza restaurant.

word.entryDescription: a room for people to wait in, for example for a bus or train, or to see a doctor or dentist
word.entryExample: I waited for my cousin in the dentist's waiting room.

word.entryDescription: a woman who takes customers' orders and serves food and drinks at tables in a restaurant
word.entryExample: Kate is working as a waitress in her father's restaurant.

word.entryDescription: to stop sleeping
word.entryExample: Do you usually wake up early?
